intro: Libertia paniculata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy panicles of white or pale blue flowers. The plant is adapted to a variety of soil types but thrives in well-drained, moist environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses by Māori people. The species is also valued for its fibrous material, which has been used historically for weaving.
